meanings.definition: The act of controlling the distribution of a limited supply of goods or resources.
meanings.sent1: During the war, rationing was necessary to ensure everyone had enough food.
meanings.sent2: The government implemented rationing to make sure everyone received their fair share of supplies.
meanings.sent3: The kids thought it was a game, pretending to do rationing with their toys.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the wise king used rationing to teach his people the value of sharing.
meanings.sent5: The concept of rationing can be seen in many post-apocalyptic movies.

meanings.definition: A fixed amount of a commodity officially allowed to each person during a time of shortage.
meanings.sent1: During the drought, the village had to rely on water rationing to make it last.
meanings.sent2: Each family received a specific rationing of bread to prevent hoarding during the crisis.
meanings.sent3: The idea of candy rationing at the party made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her love was like a strict rationing of affection, carefully measured out.
meanings.sent5: The strict rationing of fuel led to creative solutions for transportation.
